title: The Sovereign Woman
subtitle: A complete curriculum for feminine reclamation
description: A comprehensive 12-week program for women ready to reclaim their full power. This flagship course integrates body wisdom, emotional alchemy, shadow work, and sacred feminine archetypes. Move from people-pleasing and self-abandonment into authentic sovereignty.

modules.title: Reclaiming Your Body
modules.description: Coming home to the body you were taught to distrust

modules.title: The Feminine Shadow
modules.description: The parts you were told to hide

modules.title: Reclaiming Your Rage
modules.description: The anger you weren't allowed to feel

modules.title: Integrating the Seven Archetypes
modules.description: Maiden to Mystic—accessing your full range

modules.title: Boundaries and Fierce Love
modules.description: Protecting your energy without closing your heart

whatYouLearn: Reclaim your body as a source of wisdom and pleasure
Regulate your nervous system honoring feminine cycles
Integrate shadow material including rage and desire
Heal mother wounds at the root
Access and embody all seven feminine archetypes
Trust your intuition as valid intelligence
Set boundaries without guilt or hardening
Show up in relationships from wholeness not need
requirements: Commitment to 12 weeks of consistent practice
Willingness to feel what's been suppressed
Private space for emotional and somatic work

questions.question: What does 'sovereignty' mean in this context?
options: Self-governance—making choices from your center rather than others' expectations

questions.question: Why is reclaiming the body important for women?
options: Women are often taught to distrust, control, or disconnect from their bodies

questions.question: What is the feminine shadow typically composed of?
How does the mother wound typically manifest?
options: Difficulty with self-worth, competing with women, caretaking at expense of self

questions.question: Why is reclaiming rage important for women?
options: Suppressed anger becomes depression, illness, or indirect expression

questions.question: What does it mean to 'trust your knowing'?
options: Treating intuition and felt sense as valid forms of intelligence

questions.question: What is 'fierce love' in the context of boundaries?
options: Love that includes protection, limits, and refusal to abandon yourself

questions.question: Why is sisterhood important for feminine development?
options: Women heal and develop through connection with other women who can witness and support
